docs.text: - kenneth branagh , director/actor/co-writer of mary shelley's frankenstein .

docs.text: kenneth branagh's new motion picture had to compete with all the previous frankenstein-films made throughout the years in almost every part of the world , including the most controversial version of them all - directed by james whale .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dark and stormy nights , the lightning bolts , the charnel houses of spare body parts , the laboratory where victor frankenstein stirs his steaming cauldron of life are effectful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the center of the film , quieter and more thoughtful , contains the real story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: horror-fans will probably be disappointed by the total lack of horror .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: branagh has instead concentrated on serious issues : morality , philosophy and human elements of the story , and not on old fashioned horror cliches .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his version is much closer to the book than all the previous adaptions of the classic novel .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film begins and ends somewhere in the arctic ocean .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the year is 1794 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a bold captain is steering his ship through the unknown waters .

docs.text: his gole is to reach the north pole at all costs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: exhausted and on the brink of death he approaches the frightening crew .

docs.text: his name is victor frankenstein ( kenneth branagh ) and his story is so terrifying that it will scare everyone from venturing into the unknown .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the myserious stranger begins his tale , or more precisely his confession , in geneva , 1773 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is remembering his childhood and youth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: laughter , banquets and parties - a happy life , without troubles or concerns .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here victor lived with his father ( ian holm ) , mother ( cherie lunghi ) , his surrogate sister ( helena boham carter ) and his servants in happiness and harmony .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this idyllic lifestyle is suddenly changed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like thunder from a quite sky , his mother dies , giving birth to his youngest brother .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: shocked , baffled and then gradually changed by grief and despair , victor ( already interested in science ) becomes obsessed with death .

docs.text: the greatest performances comes from de niro - the monster , that has been played by ( among others ) charles ogle , karloff , lon chaney , bela lugosi , glenn strange , christopher lee , fred gwynne ( as herman munster ) , and now , robert de niro .

docs.text: later when he reads frankenstein's journal , and learns that he is composed of dead bodies , his love turns into rage as he is seeking revenge .

docs.label: positive

docs.text: another vital thing is the character of victor frankenstein .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in most of the previous adaptions he was simply a mad scientist that trolls the graveyards for corpses and then creates a monster ( god knows why ! ) with the power of an electrical storm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: almost no time was granted on his charecter , who is the most important and vital charecter in the novel .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here , branagh introduces the character of victor frankenstein , establishes his obsession with the very nature of life and death , sets up the intellectual and ideological conflict between victor and the academic establishment , and somehow manages to build up to a rousing and horrifying creation scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: branagh plays frankenstein with a remarkable understanding of his character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on the outside he is strong , ambitious and talented scientist , but deep down he is unsecure , fragile and vaulerble , constantly haunted by the ghosts from his past .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: helen boham carter is equally wonderful as frankenstein's surrogate sister , who at the end becomes his wife for a little while , before death drives them apart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of the cast , playing secondary characters , is solid and nothing less than convincing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: visually the film is stunning ( especially the makeup ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the spinning camera , the constantly building-up musical acore , the art direction , the production design , the costumes are all magnificent : from the arctic ocean to the swiss alps and dark forests , to the plague-riddled streets of ingolstadt , mary shelley's frankenstein is a wonder to behold .

docs.text: although the film is not perfect ( the camera that simply refuses to stay still and the occasionally pushy score are at times more tiering than effective ) , these minor faults are easily forgivable , as the picture is otherwise captivating and stimulating .

docs.text: branagh has probably created one of the best ( if not the best ) adaptions of shelly's classic novel .
